Name: Old Fashioned
Ingredients: 12.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill an Old-fashioned glass .
Prepare garnish of orange zest twist.
STRAIN into ice-filled glass (preferably over a large cube or chunk of block ice).
Review: Rich (medium-dry and spirituous this old-fashioned is all too easy to drink and fortunately, easy to make.
History: As with the Martini, the glass this cocktail is served in has taken the name of the drink. Its origin stems from the adaptation and renaming of a similar drink known as the Whisky Cocktail, which was shaken and served up. Who did the adapting and renaming is unknown. For the full story, see Old-Fashioned cocktail history .
Nutrition: One serving of Old Fashioned contains 192 calories
